intro: Siphocampylus stenolobus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its botanical features include a slender stem, finely divided leaves, and white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is a relatively rare and less-studied species within its native range.
